definition: to bite the hand that feeds one (idiom)
favor/grace/kindness
general/commander-in-chief (military)/king (chess piece)/to command/to lead
to desire/to invite/to request
will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])
hatred/animosity/enmity/foe/enemy/to feel animosity toward (the wealthy, foreigners etc)
spouse/companion
surname Qiu
to announce/to inform/report/newspaper/recompense/revenge/CL:份[fen4],張|张[zhang1]

sentences.english: The person always returns ingratitude for kindness.
sentences.chinese: 這個傢伙常常恩將仇報。

sentences.english: I hate people who shit where they eat.
sentences.chinese: 我討厭那種恩將仇報的人。

sentences.english: And I thanked her by becoming a lunatic and denting her car.
sentences.chinese: 我卻恩將仇報，象個瘋子一樣撞了她的車。

sentences.english: Don't you know she's the one that would bite the hand that feeds her?
sentences.chinese: 你難道不知道她是個教你怎麼寫小說恩將仇報的人？

sentences.english: He did this for you. How could bite the hand that feeds you?
sentences.chinese: 他這麼做全是爲了你，你怎麼能恩將仇報呢？

definition: foolish talk/nonsense
to drown sb in a wicker basket, a form of 沉潭[chen2 tan2]
keenly felt pain/bitter anguish
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
female gossip/busybody
to extort under false pretenses/to blackmail/to bluff/to defraud
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
to follow the path to one's own doom (idiom)/to bring about one's own destruction
lit. neither a relative nor a friend (idiom)/fig. unrelated to one another in any way
lit. firing after the horse/fig. belated action/giving advice in hindsight
sb who goes whichever way the wind blows/sb with no mind of their own/easily swayed person/opportunist
to act rashly/to act precipitously regardless of the consequences/reckless/foolhardy/daredevil
to take the blame for sb else/to compensate for one's crime/to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)
to leak (of air)/to go flat (of a tire)/to vent one's anger
to shout loudly
